title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Vertica validateAdminConfig Remote Command Injection Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Hewlett Packard Enterprise Vertica. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. 
The specific flaw exists within the validateAdminConfig handler. By providing an mcPort parameter containing command injection, an attacker can execute arbitrary commands as root.
addtionnal_details: Hewlett Packard Enterprise has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://h20564.www2.hpe.com/portal/site/hpsc/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c05085303
timeline:
2015-12-01 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2016-04-15 - Coordinated public release of advisory
